name: Lesser Blood Offering
description: Pay in blood for power. You open a small cut—nothing dramatic, just enough to matter—and the magic responds. Blood has memory. Blood has weight. The universe accepts it as currency. This is the fundamental exchange: your vitality for immediate effect. The cut heals, but the cost remains.

creatorDetection.detectionNotes: Blood magic: Life force sacrifice - draws attention through vitality manipulation

name: Crimson Bolt
description: Shape your blood into a projectile. It leaves your body as liquid and hardens mid-flight into something like glass—sharp, fast, deeply personal. The bolt carries a fragment of your life force. Hits harder than it should. Leaves enemies unsettled in ways normal weapons don't.

creatorDetection.detectionNotes: Blood magic: Weaponized blood - life force converted to damage

name: Sanguine Link
description: Mingle your blood with another's. For the next hour, you share wounds—damage to either distributes between both. Useful for protecting the fragile. Terrifying when you realize your enemy can hurt you by hurting themselves. Blood bonds are intimate magic, whether you want them to be or not.

creatorDetection.detectionNotes: Blood magic: Life-binding - connecting vital energies is noticeable

name: Crimson Strings
description: Control someone through their blood. You don't possess their mind—that's different magic—but you can pull their limbs, force movement, make the body betray its owner. Deeply unpleasant for everyone involved. The kind of spell that gets you banned from civilized society. Works beautifully.

creatorDetection.detectionNotes: FORBIDDEN: Blood puppet - controlling beings through their blood violates bodily autonomy

name: Vitality Transfer
description: Take someone's wounds into yourself. Their injuries close; yours open. The damage doesn't vanish—conservation of suffering—but it redistributes. Profoundly useful. Possibly heroic. Definitely hurts. Blood mages report this is either the kindest or cruelest spell they know, depending on context.

creatorDetection.detectionNotes: Blood magic: Wound transfer - heroic self-sacrifice, somewhat less suspicious

name: Boiling Blood
description: Raise the temperature of someone's blood. Not metaphorically—literally heating hemoglobin until it bubbles. The target feels fever spike into agony. Most lose consciousness within seconds. Mortality rate is high. This is the spell that makes people understand why blood magic is feared.

creatorDetection.detectionNotes: FORBIDDEN: Blood boiling - horrific attack spell, Supreme Creator disapproves strongly

name: Trace the Bloodline
description: Find someone through blood connection. Given a sample—a drop, a smear—you trace back to its source. Blood knows where it came from. You follow that knowledge across any distance. Privacy laws hate this spell. Detectives love it. Everyone agrees it's uncomfortably effective.

creatorDetection.detectionNotes: Blood magic: Bloodline tracking - invasive but not forbidden

name: Surge of Vitality
description: Burn your life force for temporary strength. Muscles swell. Reflexes sharpen. You become briefly superhuman by converting longevity into immediate capability. The effect fades after five minutes. You'll feel it later—exhaustion, accelerated aging, the bill coming due. Worth it in emergencies.

creatorDetection.detectionNotes: Blood magic: Vitality surge - burning life for power

name: Forced Regeneration
description: Accelerate your healing to unnatural rates. Wounds close in seconds. Broken bones set themselves. You're burning through vitality reserves normally saved for decades of life. Ten minutes of regeneration might cost weeks off your lifespan. The math is unfavorable but the alternative is death.

creatorDetection.detectionNotes: Blood magic: Accelerated regeneration - burning years for minutes

name: Vampiric Touch
description: Steal life force through contact. Your touch draws vitality from the target into yourself. Their wounds become your healing. Their exhaustion becomes your energy. Technically not vampirism—you're not drinking blood—but the emotional experience is similar. Most targets strongly object.

creatorDetection.detectionNotes: FORBIDDEN: Vampiric touch - stealing life force from others crosses ethical lines
